snippet: Greek elections on Sunday could soon bring real-world urgency to a debate that had been largely academic: Whether the euro zone can withstand the departure of one of its members.
abstract: Greek elections could soon bring real-world urgency to a debate that had been largely academic: whether the euro zone can withstand the departure of one of its members; some economists say Greece's departure from the euro will not be that great of a shock because there has been time to prepare.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and PAUL GEITNER
byline.contributor: Stephen Castle contributed reporting from London and David Jolly from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Greek elections on Sunday could soon bring real-world urgency to a debate that had been largely academic: Whether the euro zone can withstand the departure of one of its members.

headline.main: Europe Braces for Greek Vote — and Maybe More
headline.print_headline: Facing Greek Vote, Euro Zone Ponders What-Ifs
